title: Implement EIP-712 Signing API
body:
Geth lacks an API to perform an EIP-712 conforming signature for a given unlocked account. An API should be implemented that allows for arbitrary data to be signed by a specified unlocked account. This API will encompass signing as well as verifying functionalities.

Current API:
https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_sign

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 1500.0 DAI (1500.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233). * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $26,657.67 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. **Done** 

<hr>

__Work has been started__.


These users each claimed they can complete the work by 6¬†months, 1¬†week from now.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [andremarianiello](https://gitcoin.co/profile/andremarianiello) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=andremarianiello) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=andremarianiello))_.**

I use Go professionally every day, butI have never used geth or ethereum. As long as you don't think those would prevent me from completing this issue according to you timeframe, I would like to give it a shot. I do have a couple questions though:

1) Why hasn't this functionality been implemented yet, and
2) What do you expect to be the most difficult part of implementing this task?

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233).


**2) [paulrberg](https://gitcoin.co/profile/paulrberg) has been approved to start work.**

As per of the latest comments on #17696, I'd love to implement both EIP-191 and EIP-712 into geth.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233).

Hi @ andremarianiello ! See my comment at https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/17696 . 

I also think it would make sense that the same person implemented both of these. 

And if you're a professional Go-coder, I don't think it matters much if you're not familiar with geth/ethereum, normally. However, these two (eips 191 and 712) will require quite a lot of discussion and coordination with other actors in the space, like metamask, MEW, web3.js/web3.py people etc. So for this particular one, it is probably a lot easier for someone who knows the ecosystem a bit.

@holiman Thanks for the response.  I didn't see the other issue. If I read EIP-712 correctly, I was expecting a couple hours of work to implement the object -> bytestring conversion, then reuse existing signing code to sign the resulting bytes. Since the signing part isn't done yet (I assumed https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/signer/core/api.go#L378 was the implementation you wanted because I didn't know about the EIP-191 ticket), I guess it makes sense to have the same person do both (even though the object -> bytestring translation is pretty self-contained IMO). And since I'm curious, what sort of coordination is required for this? I assumed that the EIP serving as the source of truth would be sufficient, but like you said, I don't know the ecosystem.

PS: If you want PaulRBerg to do this one as well, you might want to have him apply for it on gitcoin, and mark this issue as not "Open" on gitcoin so that you don't get any more spurious applications.
The difficult part, imo,  is what to present to the user, that makes it clear what is being signed.
Hey @paulrberg would love to have you helping out on this as well but are you sure you have time to implement both within a reasonable time frame?

Hey Scott, oh yeah definitely! The EIPs intertwine and is hard to research and work on one without referencing the other. Plus, as pointed before, the trickiest part with signing data is to coordinate with library, wallet and dapp developers.

I am more than happy to contribute to other repos such as web3.py to fully implement these issues.
@PaulRBerg Sounds good, keep us updated on progress! :)

@PaulRBerg Hello from Gitcoin Core - are you still working on this issue? Please submit a WIP PR or comment back within the next 3 days or you will be removed from this ticket and it will be returned to an ‚ÄòOpen‚Äô status. Please let us know if you have questions!
* [x] warning (3 days)
* [ ] escalation to mods (6 days)

Funders only: Snooze warnings for [1 day](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233?snooze=1) | [3 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233?snooze=3) | [5 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233?snooze=5) | [10 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233?snooze=10) | [100 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum/go-ethereum/17697/1233?snooze=100)

It would be redundant to comment on both this thread and EIP-191. Plus, lately, I sorted most questions I had privately on Discord. Is there any way to disable these warnings @ceresstation? If not, I can post here too, but it'd notify everyone involved twice.

Hi @PaulRBerg just snoozed Gitcoin Bot for 100 days here; thanks for the context that you're working through this on Discord. Would appreciate updates here ever-so-often so we know things are moving, but don't feel the need to do so every 3 days üôÇ
Thank you! Absolutely, I'll keep you updated. Already submitted two small PRs related to `clef`: #17745 and #17759.

A quick update here: https://github.com/PaulRBerg/go-ethereum/commit/0b952c17c47d62381bdbb74ec1e1434a1906c7bf

Currently working on the`typedData` validation.
Great to hear @PaulRBerg, thanks for the update!

Hey @holiman @PaulRBerg hope things are going well! Just wanted to follow up to see if there was anything we could do on our end to help out here.

So, the brunt of the work is indeed done, it's on my plate now to go through the PR for review before including it. It's quite a big PR, so I have been putting it off a bit. 
I think it needs some more work before it will be committed. 

If anyone wants to help out, it would help to have additional eyes on the implementation. In particular, how it handles bad or outright malicious inputs. It should never `panic`, and it should also handle erroneous input correctly (i.e detect the error and not actually make a signature). 

To this end, it would be good with a set of test vectors for signed data, both valid and invalid data.
This is the PR : https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/17789
The PR has now been merged into master. @ceresstation please do the payout, if it's not already done. Thanks!
